Wipro proposed funding a comprehensive study for long-term solutions.

This action coincides with recent unrest in Ladakh over demands for statehood and constitutional protections.

Abhishek Sharma's explosive 75 off 37 balls set the stage for India's 168/6, while Kuldeep Yadav's 3/18 restricted Bangladesh to 127. India will now face either Pakistan or Bangladesh in the final.

She balances style, social influence, and philanthropy, establishing herself as a prominent figure in Edmonton.

title: Karnataka caste survey: HC declines to interfere; asks to make participation voluntary
description: The Karnataka High Court has allowed the state's caste survey to proceed. The court mandated that participation must be voluntary. Authorities are barred from disclosing participant data. The survey aims to record the socio-economic status of all castes in Karnataka. The survey experienced a slow start due to technical glitches. Enumerators faced issues with the mobile application and network connectivity.

title: Wayanad Congress turmoil: DCC chief quits after Priyanka Gandhi Vadra's visit
description: N D Appachan resigned as Wayanad DCC president amid internal conflicts, leaving his fate to the KPCC's decision. This move follows Priyanka Gandhi's constituency visit and a period of factionalism within the Wayanad Congress. The party has also faced controversy due to recent suicides and a suicide attempt linked to local leaders.

title: 'Rampur, Mudhol': BSF turns to Indian dog breeds - what inspired shift?
description: Inspired by PM Modi's 'Mann Ki Baat', the BSF is training and deploying Indian dog breeds like Rampur Hound and Mudhol Hound along India's borders. Around 150 Indian breed dogs have been trained and deployed, adding to the 700 dogs already serving. Riya, a BSF-bred Indian dog, won the Best Tracker Dog award in 2024, showcasing their capabilities.

title: CBSE 2026: Class 12th Arts tentative schedule released; check dates here

Students can start preparing based on this schedule, focusing on conceptual understanding, regular practice, and revision. Practical exams will also be conducted alongside theory papers, and following structured preparation strategies can help students boost performance.

title: Kuwait sees over 2,600 divorces in 2025 amid surge in early marital breakdowns
description: Between January and July 2025, Kuwait recorded over 2,600 divorces, including a sharp rise in early marital breakdowns and 222 khula cases initiated by women. In response, the Ministry of Justice is expanding reconciliation centers and launching awareness campaigns to address rising divorce rates and promote family stability across the country.

description: Kylie Kelce, mother of four, humorously addresses the complexities of traveling with children on her podcast. She highlights the unrealistic expectations of casually bringing babies along, emphasizing the extensive planning involved. From packing portable cribs and endless supplies to navigating strollers and car seats, Kelce points out the mental and physical load parents bear.

title: US may lose AI race to China, warns Google’s ex-CEO
description: Former Google CEO Eric Schmidt cautioned that the US might lose the AI race to China, citing China's focus on applying AI across various sectors. He highlighted China's open-source approach to AI models, contrasting it with the US's emphasis on closed systems.

Wankhede seeks damages of Rs 2 crore and a restraint on the show's streaming, claiming it misrepresents events and violates national honor laws.

Mega defence deal: Centre inks Rs 62K cr pact for 97 Tejas jets; big boost for IAF
description: The Defence Ministry has signed a significant deal with Hindustan Aeronautics Limited. The agreement involves procuring 97 LCA Mk1A aircraft for the Indian Air Force. This includes 68 fighter jets and 29 twin-seaters. Deliveries are expected to begin in 2027-28. The project emphasizes indigenous content and advanced systems. It will boost self-reliance in defence manufacturing.

title: A first for Indian cricket: Ashwin joins Sydney Thunder, to play in BBL next season
description: R Ashwin, the veteran Indian off-spinner, is set to make history as the first male Indian player in the Big Bash League, joining the Sydney Thunder for BBL 15. Following his international and IPL retirement, the 39-year-old aims to bolster the Thunder's campaign, bringing leadership and connecting with Western Sydney's Indian community.

Germany offers stable migration policies and good job prospects. This shift may alter where Indian professionals seek work abroad.

US senator urges end to student work permits: Is OPT the next target?
description: Senator Chuck Grassley urges DHS to end work permits for student visa holders, citing competition with Americans and national security risks. His call targets OPT, a key program allowing international students to gain post-graduation work experience. The move could significantly affect Indian students, the largest group in the US, potentially limiting pathways to STEM employment and impacting higher education and H-1B visa prospects.

title: Was Ladakh violence incited by comparisons to Nepal? Wangchuk says youths lost limbs
description: In Ladakh, four protesters died and 58 were wounded after security forces allegedly fired on demonstrators demanding Sixth Schedule protections and statehood. The violence, the first since Ladakh became a Union territory in 2019, erupted after hunger strikers collapsed, prompting mass protests. Activist Sonam Wangchuk condemned the police action, while officials cited stone-throwing by protesters and damage to property.

title: ‘Tujhe maarke jail bi jaana pade toh jaunga': Uber driver threatens women in Noida
description: An Uber cab driver in Noida was arrested after allegedly abusing and threatening a group of women passengers following a disagreement over the route. The driver reportedly brandished a pipe and threatened the women after they asked him to take an underpass to avoid traffic.

title: Bill Gates credits 15 Indian engineers, says they built Microsoft; viral video
description: Amidst H-1B visa fee hikes and debates, a resurfaced video shows Bill Gates recalling Microsoft's early recruitment of Indian engineers from IITs in the 1980s. Gates emphasizes that this decision was crucial for Microsoft's growth, despite initial criticism about brain drain and concerns over American jobs.
